full_summary:
# Methanol to Hydrogen Reformers for Shipboard Use
## Request for Information

### Request Overview

The Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC) on behalf of the Canadian Coast Guard (CCG) invites industry stakeholders to provide input on Methanol-to-Hydrogen Reformers as a potential power generation system for CCG’s future fleet.

### Background

The CCG is planning to acquire new Shallow Draft Buoy Tenders and is exploring the use of a hydrogen fuel cell power system fed by a methanol reformer to reduce greenhouse gas emissions. This Request for Information (RFI) aims to gather information from the industry on the availability, maturity, and functionality of this technology.

#### Power Generation Requirements

The CCG is seeking information on:

* Supplier availability and experience in providing power generation systems for marine vessels.
* Technical specifications of methanol-to-hydrogen reformers, including performance, efficiency, and reliability.
* Feasibility of integrating a methanol-to-hydrogen reformer system with other equipment on board CCG’s vessels.
* Cost estimates for implementing this technology.

### Industry Input

Industry stakeholders are invited to provide input on the following:

* Technical information on methanol-to-hydrogen reformers.
* Supplier availability and readiness to provide this technology.
* Update on the development and commercialization of this technology.
* Any other relevant information that may support the adoption of this technology for CCG’s future fleet.
